itemBody.p: Do you believe labor unions are a positive force?

modalFeedback.p: You agree with democratic socialists. They believe unions are essential on two fronts: to hold companies accountable to their workers and, in the long term, to empower workers to challenge capitalism as a whole.

Making it easier for workers to unionize “changes the power dynamic between workers and bosses,” Ms. Svart said. Strikes “demonstrate that our society can’t function without the work of millions of people,” she added. “They can’t run the economy without us.”
Ultimately, democratic socialists want workers to control the means of production. In the meantime, they see unions as a way to give workers more power under capitalism.
